content.question: What is the sum of the areas of the three regions enclosed by the graph of the polar curve <math alttext="r equals, the sine of theta squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to 0, less than or equal to the square root of 3 pi, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>≤</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.8: (BC ONLY) Find the Area of a Polar Region or the Area Bounded by a Single Polar Curve

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
